sen.e: Jikun (or Jikin, [in Emperor Jito's 5th reign] 691 - 777) was a priest at Nara Kofuku-ji Temple in Nara period.

sen.j: 740年（天平12年）審祥による華厳経の法会で副講師をつとめ、755年（天平勝宝7歳）には宮中講師となる。
sen.e: In 740, Shinjo held a Kegon-kyo Sutra (Avatamska doctrine sutra) Hoe (Buddhist mass), Jikun acted as the vice Lecturer, and he became the Imperial Court Lecturer in 755.

sen.j: 翌756年（天平勝宝8歳）聖武天皇が病気となった際、良弁・安寛とともに看病禅師・華厳講師をつとめ、その功により少僧都に任じられた。
sen.e: In the next yea, in 756, Emperor Shomu became ill, and then Shinjo, together with Roben and Ankan, acted as a Nursing-Dhyana-Priests and Lecturers on Kegon, due to which he was appointed Shosozu.

sen.j: 760年（天平宝字4年）良弁らとともに僧位制度の改正を奏上している。
sen.e: In 760 together with Roben and others, Shinjo proposed an amendment of the priest rank system to the Emperor.

sen.j: その後道鏡が現れると763年（天平宝字7年）僧綱を解任されたが、770年（宝亀元年）少僧都に復帰している。
sen.e: After this proposition, when Dokyo came into power, he was deprived of his Sogo (priestly rank) in 763, but was returned as Shosozu (the third grade that can be held by one who has reached the second highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests) in 770.
